description: Ali Truwit is set to compete at the Paralympics one year after her leg had to be amputated following a shark attack. Jericka Duncan shares her story.
title: Swimmer who lost leg in shark attack competes at Paralympics

description: Vice President Kamala Harris and her running mate, Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz, are looking to expand their ground game and bring on some 2,000 staffers in the crucial battleground states. Skyler Henry has the latest on both campaigns.
title: Harris and Walz look to expand ground game in battleground states

description: Labor Day is expected to be a major travel day both on the roads and in the air. CBS Philadelphia meteorologist Andrew Kozak has the forecast for the holiday.
title: A look at the Labor Day forecast

description: Thousands of workers at major hotel chains like Hyatt, Marriot and Omni have begun striking on Sunday, and the walkout could spread if a deal is not reached. Shanelle Kaul has the details.
title: Workers at major hotel chains begin strike

description: Thousands of Israelis took to the streets Sunday after Israel's military said it had recovered the bodies of six hostages in Gaza. Among them was Israeli-American Hersh Goldberg-Polin
title: Protests erupt in Israel after 6 hostages found dead

description: Here's a look at the top stories making headlines on the "CBS Weekend News" with Jericka Duncan.
title: "CBS Weekend News" headlines for Sunday, Sept. 1, 2024

description: Secretary of Commerce Gina Raimondo is focused on U.S. advanced microchip production — and keeping the chips out of China and Russia.
title: Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo on microchip production, sales

description: A piece of Holocaust history — a Nazi concentration camp built on Alderney, a British island — has been largely forgotten. Researchers have worked to count the island's dead.
title: Death toll reviewed for Nazi concentration camps built on British island

description: Secretary of Commerce Gina Raimondo is focused on U.S. advanced microchip production — and keeping the chips out of China and Russia.
title: Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo: The 60 Minutes Interview

description: A piece of Holocaust history — a Nazi concentration camp built on Alderney, a British island — has been largely forgotten. Researchers have worked to count the island's dead.
title: Investigating the horrors of a Nazi concentration camp built on British soil

description: A high school teacher didn’t expect a solution when she set a 2,000-year-old Pythagorean Theorem problem in front of her students. Then Calcea Johnson and Ne’Kiya Jackson stepped up to the challenge.
title: Teens surprise math world with Pythagorean Theorem trigonometry proof | 60 Minutes

description: The father of an Israeli-American still held captive by Hamas reiterated calls for a cease-fire and the release of the remaining hostages.
title: Father of Israeli-American hostage urges cease-fire, hostage deal

description: Projections for ARD and ZDF public television based on exit polls and partial counting showed Alternative for Germany winning 32-33% of the vote in Thuringia.
title: Germany election results show far-right party set to win first state vote

description: Sean O'Brien, president of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, spoke at the RNC in July.
title: Teamsters chief on 2024 endorsement: "You don't hire someone unless you give them an interview"

description: Complex climactic conditions were the main cause of the helicopter crash that killed Iran's President Ebrahim Raisi, Iranian state TV reported.
title: Helicopter crash that killed Iran's president caused by weather: report

description: On this "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" broadcast, Jonathan Dekel-Chen and Massachusetts Gov. Maura Healey join Nancy Cordes.
title: Full transcript of "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Sept. 1, 2024

description: A beluga whale named Hvaldimir, first spotted in Norway with a harness that sparked rumors he may be a Russian spy, was found dead.
title: "Russian spy" whale found dead in water off Norway

description: At least 15,000 workers have voted to authorize strikes if no agreements are reached after contracts expire at hotels in 12 cities, from Honolulu to Boston.
title: Strikes start at top hotel chains across the country

description: This week on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," in the aftermath of the discovery of the bodies of six people who were being held hostage by Hamas, Nancy Cordes speaks to Jonathan Dekel-Chen, the father of the Israeli-Americans still being held. Plus, Rep. Tony Gonzales of Texas joins as migrant crossings along the southern border reach historic lows amid a new asylum crackdown from the Biden administration.
title: 9/1: Face the Nation

description: Missed the second half of the show? The latest on...Sean O'Brien, the president of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, says his union hasn't endorsed a 2024 candidate because they are "waiting on Vice President Harris to commit to come meet with us, Republican Rep. Tony Gonzales of Texas tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that he thinks the immigration crisis is getting "worse" despite record low numbers of migrant crossings, and David Becker, a former civil rights attorney at the Department of Justice who now leads the Center of Election Innovation and Research and a CBS News contributor, tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that those with election concerns should volunteer.
title: Face the Nation: O'Brien, Gonzales, Becker

description: David Becker, a former civil rights attorney at the Department of Justice who now leads the Center of Election Innovation and Research and a CBS News contributor, tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that those with election concerns should volunteer. "Volunteer to be a poll worker," he said.
title: David Becker says those with concerns about election should "volunteer to join them"

description: Morteza Mehrzadselakjani — who is 8 feet 0.85 inches tall — is the star player of Iran's sitting volleyball team.
title: World's second tallest man forced to sleep on floor at Paralympics

description: Amid the Biden administration's executive action on immigration, migrants are being deported quickly to Mexico. Camilo Montoya-Galvez reports from the U.S.-Mexico border.
title: Migrants are quickly returned to Mexico under Biden's asylum crackdown

description: Republican Rep. Tony Gonzales of Texas tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that he thinks the immigration crisis is getting "worse" despite record low numbers of migrant crossings. Amid the Congressional impasses on the bipartisan immigration bill, he says he has written his own three-page bill.
title: Rep. Tony Gonzales of Texas says he is writing his own bill amid immigration impasse

description: Massachusetts Gov. Maura Healey, who signed a maternal health bill in her state last week, tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that she doesn't "believe anything that Donald Trump says," including his recent support of IVF. "I don't think Donald Trump can spell IVF, let alone understand what it means, because his own Project 2025, remember, which establishes a fetal personhood, would undermine and take away IVF treatment," Healey added.
title: Mass. Gov. Maura Healey says Trump can't "spell IVF, let alone understand what it means"

description: Sean O'Brien, the president of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, says his union hasn't endorsed a 2024 candidate because they are "waiting on Vice President Harris to commit to come meet with us." "You don't hire someone unless you give them an interview," O'Brien told "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan."
title: Teamsters president says union hasn't backed Harris yet because they are waiting for a meeting

description: The former president responded to Harris with a series of short videos from the families, including those that did and did not formally invite him to attend the memorial at Arlington National Cemetery.
title: Several Gold Star families defend Trump's cemetery visit, criticize Harris

description: Jonathan Dekel-Chen, whose son is being held hostage by Hamas, tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that negotiating with them is like "dealing with Satan." But, he added," Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu "has made choices to pursue this fantasy of total victory over Hamas, a terrorist organization, and no doubt, but this idea of total victory is a messianic one from his coalition partners, and not realistic."
title: Father of Israeli-American hostage says negotiating with Hamas is "dealing with Satan"

description: The bodies of six people being held hostage by Hamas, including Israeli-American Hersh Goldberg-Polin, were found early Sunday in Gaza. Imtiaz Tyab reports from Tel Aviv with the latest.
title: Bodies of six Hamas-held hostages found in Gaza

description: This week on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," in the aftermath of the discovery of the bodies of six people who were being held hostage by Hamas, Nancy Cordes speaks to Jonathan Dekel-Chen, the father of the Israeli-Americans still being held. Plus, Rep. Tony Gonzales of Texas joins as migrant crossings along the southern border reach historic lows amid a new asylum crackdown from the Biden administration.
title: Open: This is "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Sept. 1, 2024

description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Rep. Tony Gonzales, Republican of Texas, on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that aired on Sept. 1, 2024.
title: Transcript: Rep. Tony Gonzales on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Sept. 1, 2024

description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Massachusetts Gov. Maura Healey on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that aired on Sept. 1, 2024.
title: Transcript: Massachusetts Gov. Maura Healey on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Sept. 1, 2024

description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Sean O'Brien, president of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that aired on Sept. 1, 2024.
title: Transcript: Teamsters president Sean O'Brien on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Sept. 1, 2024

description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Jonathan Dekel-Chen, whose son is being held hostage by Hamas, on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that aired on Sept. 1, 2024.
title: Transcript: H.R. McMaster, former National Security Adviser, on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Aug. 25, 2024

description: Under President Biden's June proclamation, migrants who cross the southern border between legal entry points are generally disqualified from asylum.
title: "Deportations are 24/7": Migrants are quickly returned to Mexico

description: In this web extra, Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson talks with "CBS Evening News" anchor and managing editor Norah O'Donnell about her dissent in the Supreme Court's recent rulings that struck down the use of race as a factor in U.S. college admissions.
title: Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson on Supreme Court's affirmative action rulings

description: We leave you this Sunday overlooking Sand Dollar Beach in Monterey County, California. Videographer: Ed Givnish.
title: Nature: Sand Dollar Beach

description: In Hibbing, Minnesota, the birthplace of the bus industry, one man's fascination with the rise of the ubiquitous Greyhound bus has led to the creation of a monument to the iconic mode of transportation that helped connect all corners of America. Correspondent Jennifer Mayerle, of CBS Station WCCO in Minnesota, visits the Greyhound Bus Museum, as part of the "Sunday Morning" series "Diversions."
title: All aboard! at the Greyhound Bus Museum

description: "From my perspective, I don't have any problem with an enforceable code," Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson told CBS News.
title: Ketanji Brown Jackson says she's open to enforceable Supreme Court ethics code

description: Patti LuPone, the star of "Evita" and "Gypsy," is returning to Broadway alongside her longtime friend Mia Farrow in a new play, "The Roommate," which explores the strength, depth, humor and surprise found in women of a certain age.
title: Mia Farrow and Patti LuPone: Pals, and now co-stars on Broadway

description: Patti LuPone, the star of "Evita" and "Gypsy," is returning to Broadway alongside her longtime friend Mia Farrow in a new play, "The Roommate," which explores the strength, depth, humor and surprise found in women of a certain age. Correspondent Seth Doane talks with LuPone about the power of women with experience, and of an actor's longevity; and with Farrow about how she views her career, from the 13 films she made with director Woody Allen, to what she views as the best part she's ever been offered.
title: Mia Farrow and Patti LuPone on Broadway

description: On a holiday weekend, most of us enjoy an extra day to relax. Comedian Jim Gaffigan is not most people.
title: Jim Gaffigan works out his Labor Day weekend complaints

description: On a holiday weekend, most of us enjoy an extra day to relax. Comedian Jim Gaffigan is not most people.
title: Jim Gaffigan works out his Labor Day weekend complaints

description: An exhibition of giant creatures is currently touring the country, spreading a message of coexistence between humans and the animal world. Correspondent Nancy Giles reports on "The Great Elephant Migration," which features sculptures depicting a herd of elephants, created by artists in India to benefit both indigenous artisans and conservation efforts.
title: Elephant sculptures make their way across the U.S.

description: After more than 40 years, the game show that's a TV institution has a new host, someone who's a broadcast institution himself: Ryan Seacrest, whose journey has taken him from tiny Dunwoody, Ga., to working with TV royalty Vanna White.
title: Ryan Seacrest takes a spin as new host of "Wheel of Fortune"

description: After more than 40 years, the game show "Wheel of Fortune" has a new host, someone with a long resume of popular TV and radio programs: Ryan Seacrest. He talks with correspondent Luke Burbank about his improbable life's journey from Dunwoody, Ga., to Hollywood, and hosting a TV institution. Burbank also talks with "Wheel" regular Vanna White about finding the chemistry with her new hosting partner.
title: Ryan Seacrest takes a spin as new "Wheel of Fortune" host

description: A warrant filed by university police says Watkins assaulted the victim by "forcefully grabbing her face, pulling her arms and pushing."
title: South Carolina basketball star charged with assault and kidnapping

description: "Sunday Morning" remembers some of the notable figures who recently left us, including French actor Alain Delon, star of such classics as "Le Samouraï" and "The Leopard."
title: Passage: In memoriam

description: In her conversation with "Sunday Morning," Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson talks about one of the court's most divisive decisions, as well as her own journey to becoming the first Black woman to sit on the nation's highest court.
title: Highlights from Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson's CBS News interview

description: In her first broadcast interview, Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson talks about her historic ascension to the nation's highest court; her dissent in the Trump immunity decision; and the controversy over ethics involving justices.
title: Ketanji Brown Jackson on Supreme Court ethics and court's future

description: Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson, the first Black woman to sit on the Supreme Court, has a new memoir out Tuesday called "Lovely One." In her first broadcast interview since joining the nation's highest court, Jackson talks with "CBS Evening News" anchor and managing editor Norah O'Donnell about her historic ascension; the controversy over ethics involving Supreme Court justices; her dissent in the case of presidential immunity involving former President Donald Trump; and how she learned to persevere from parents who grew up in the segregated South.
title: Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson on Supreme Court ethics, presidential immunity

description: After years of preparation, the completed National World War I Memorial, featuring a 60-foot-long bronze relief sculpture dramatizing the horrors of war, will be unveiled this month in Washington D.C.
title: Creating a memorial to the horrors of World War I

description: Washington, D.C., is home to numerous monuments, with a conspicuous omission: there has been no national memorial to the soldiers who'd fought and died in the First World War. After more than eight years of preparation, the completed World War I Memorial will be unveiled at a September ceremony – 106 years after the armistice ending the war was signed. Correspondent Faith Salie talks with Joseph Weishaar, who was a 25-year-old architectural intern when his design for the memorial beat out more than 360 applicants from over 20 countries; and with artist Sabin Howard, for whom devising and sculpting the 60-foot-long sculpture dramatizing the horrors of war, titled "A Soldier's Journey," was itself a battle between those frequent belligerents: artist and bureaucracy.
title: Creating a memorial to the horrors of World War I

description: Actress, writer, director and producer Natasha Lyonne, who earned Emmy nominations for "Orange Is the New Black," "Russian Doll" and "Poker Face," has been an infectious presence on-screen for decades, playing characters who tend to be funny, perceptive, and a little weird. Lyonne talked with "Sunday Morning" contributor Kelefa Sanneh about bringing her magnetic talent to the new film "His Three Daughters," and about how her chaotic childhood may have prepared her for a life being, as Time magazine put it, "the coolest person in the room."
title: The multi-faceted Natasha Lyonne

description: "Sunday Morning" looks back at historical events on this date.
title: Almanac: September 1

description: Drivers on Highway 1, a ribbon of road that hugs the California coastline, are afforded spectacular views. But in recent years, fierce storms, landslides and wildfires have closed sections of the highway, blocking access to communities like Big Sur.
title: Road closure: Keeping California's scenic Highway 1 open

description: Drivers on Highway 1, a ribbon of road that hugs the California coastline, are afforded spectacular views as mountains cascade into the sea. But in recent years, fierce storms, landslides and wildfires have closed sections of the highway, blocking access to communities like Big Sur. Correspondent Ben Tracy looks at what might be involved in keeping this highway – a destination in itself – open to traffic.
title: Keeping California's scenic Highway 1 open

description: Authorities plan to vaccinate children in central Gaza until Wednesday before moving on to the more devastated northern and southern parts of the strip.
title: Large-scale polio vaccination campaign begins in Gaza

description: President Biden announced late Saturday that the bodies of six Hamas-held hostages were recovered in a tunnel under the Gaza city of Rafah.
title: Israeli-American among 6 hostages found dead in Gaza

description: The Israeli military said the six were killed shortly before Israeli forces were to rescue them.
title: Who were the 6 hostages whose bodies were recovered in Gaza?

description: After proudly cheering on his wife at the Paris Games, Hunter Woodhall will get his own chance to compete for gold during the Paralympics.
title: Hunter Woodhall and Tara Davis-Woodhall win Olympic medals, and Americans' hearts

description: The twin-engine Cessna crashed into a row of condo units, several of which caught fire, officials said.
title: Small plane crashes into residential building near Portland, officials say

description: The USC Trojans and the LSU Tigers face off today for Week 1 of the 2024-2025 NCAA college football season.
title: How to watch the USC vs. LSU NCAA football game today

description: Sources told CBS News Philadelphia that Okaloosa County leaders plan to discuss in a meeting on Tuesday whether or not the SS United States should be sunk off their coast as part of an artificial reef.
title: SS United States could move to Florida, turned into artificial reef

description: The San Francisco 49ers said that Ricky Pearsall was in "serious but stable condition" after sustaining a "bullet wound to the chest."
title: Niners rookie Ricky Pearsall shot during attempted robbery in San Francisco
